Reason: The _journalAgeThreshold configuration option in the prevayler software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the frequency at which journal entries are aged and potentially removed from the system. A lower threshold value may result in more frequent journal maintenance operations, leading to increased execution time and memory consumption. Conversely, a higher threshold value may delay journal maintenance operations, affecting system performance in a different way. Therefore, changes to the _journalAgeThreshold value can significantly affect system performance, making it a performance-sensitive configuration option.
